intro: Ternstroemia urdanetensis, commonly known as the Urdanet holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Theaceae. It is native to the humid forests of Venezuela and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are glossy and dark green, while its flowers are white or pale yellow, often appearing in clusters. Ternstroemia urdanetensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
